intro: Orinus thoroldii, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Orinus thoroldii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
